trans-unit.source: In contrast to R’s factor function, categorical data is not converting input values to strings; categories will end up the same data type as the original values.
trans-unit.target: 与R的 factor 函数相反，分类数据不会将输入值转换为字符串；类别最终将具有与原始值相同的数据类型。

trans-unit.source: In contrast to R’s factor function, there is currently no way to assign/change labels at creation time. Use categories to change the categories after creation time.
trans-unit.target: 与R的 factor 函数相反，当前无法在创建时分配/更改标签。在创建时间之后，使用 categories 更改类别。

trans-unit.source: In contrast to R’s factor function, using categorical data as the sole input to create a new categorical series will not remove unused categories but create a new categorical series which is equal to the passed in one!
trans-unit.target: 与R的 factor 函数相反，使用类别数据作为唯一输入来创建新的类别序列不会删除未使用的类别，而是会创建一个新的类别序列，该类别等于传入的类别！

trans-unit.source: In contrast to R’s factor, categorical data can have categories of other types than string.
trans-unit.target: 与R factor 相反，分类数据可以具有除字符串以外的其他类型的分类。

trans-unit.source: In contrast to statistical categorical variables, categorical data might have an order (e.g. ‘strongly agree’ vs ‘agree’ or ‘first observation’ vs. ‘second observation’), but numerical operations (additions, divisions, …) are not possible.
trans-unit.target: 与统计分类变量相比，分类数据可能具有顺序（例如“完全同意”与“同意”或“第一次观察”与“第二次观察”），但是数字运算（加法，除法……）是不可能的。

trans-unit.target: 在统计中，核密度估计（KDE）是估计随机变量的概率密度函数（PDF）的非参数方法。此功能使用高斯内核，并包括自动带宽确定。

trans-unit.target: 在统计中，插补是用替换值替换缺失数据的过程[1]。重新采样数据时，可能会出现缺失值（例如，当重新采样频率高于原始频率时）。

trans-unit.source: In statistics, imputation is the process of replacing missing data with substituted values [1]. When resampling data, missing values may appear (e.g., when the resampling frequency is higher than the original frequency). The backward fill will replace NaN values that appeared in the resampled data with the next value in the original sequence. Missing values that existed in the original data will not be modified.
trans-unit.target: 在统计中，插补是用替换值替换缺失数据的过程[1]。重新采样数据时，可能会出现缺失值（例如，当重新采样频率高于原始频率时）。向后填充将用原始序列中的下一个值替换出现在重采样数据中的NaN值。原始数据中存在的缺失值将不会被修改。

trans-unit.source: In statistics, imputation is the process of replacing missing data with substituted values [1]. trans-unit.source: In terms of performance, the first time a function is run using the Numba engine will be slow as Numba will have some function compilation overhead. trans-unit.target: 在性能方面，由于Numba会产生一些函数编译开销，因此首次使用Numba引擎运行函数会很慢。但是，已编译的函数将被缓存，并且随后的调用将很快。通常，Numba引擎具有大量数据点（例如1+百万）的性能。

trans-unit.source: In this part of the tutorial, we will investigate how to speed up certain functions operating on pandas DataFrames using three different techniques: Cython, Numba and pandas.eval(). We will see a speed improvement of ~200 when we use Cython and Numba on a test function operating row-wise on the DataFrame. Using pandas.eval() we will speed up a sum by an order of ~2.
trans-unit.target: 在本部分的教程中，我们将研究如何使用三种不同的技术（Cython，Numba和 pandas.eval() )加快在熊猫 DataFrames 上运行某些功能的速度。我们将看到〜200的速度提高时，我们就用用Cython和Numba在测试功能操作按行 DataFrame 。使用 pandas.eval() ,我们可以将总和加快〜2的数量级。

trans-unit.source: Increasingly, packages are being built on top of pandas to address specific needs in data preparation, analysis and visualization. This is encouraging because it means pandas is not only helping users to handle their data tasks but also that it provides a better starting point for developers to build powerful and more focused data tools. The creation of libraries that complement pandas’ functionality also allows pandas development to remain focused around it’s original requirements.
trans-unit.target: 越来越多地在大熊猫之上构建软件包，以满足数据准备，分析和可视化的特定需求。这令人鼓舞，因为这意味着熊猫不仅在帮助用户处理数据任务，而且为开发人员构建功能强大且更具针对性的数据工具提供了一个更好的起点。创建补充熊猫功能的库还可以使熊猫开发始终专注于原始需求。

trans-unit.source: Increasingly, packages are being built on top of pandas to address specific needs in data preparation, analysis and visualization. Vaex is a python library for Out-of-Core DataFrames (similar to Pandas), to visualize and explore big tabular datasets. It can calculate statistics such as mean, sum, count, standard deviation etc, on an N-dimensional grid up to a billion (10<sup>9</sup>) objects/rows per second. Visualization is done using histograms, density plots and 3d volume rendering, allowing interactive exploration of big data. Vaex uses memory mapping, zero memory copy policy and lazy computations for best performance (no memory wasted).
trans-unit.target: 越来越多地在大熊猫之上构建软件包，以满足数据准备，分析和可视化的特定需求。Vaex是用于核心数据框（类似于Pandas）的python库，用于可视化和探索大型表格数据集。它可以在高达每秒十亿（10 <sup>9</sup>）个对象/行的N维网格上计算统计信息，例如平均值，总和，计数，标准差等。可视化使用直方图，密度图和3d体积渲染完成，从而允许交互式探索大数据。Vaex使用内存映射，零内存复制策略和惰性计算来获得最佳性能（不浪费内存）。

trans-unit.source: Indexes are “mostly immutable”, but it is possible to set and change their name attribute. You can use the rename, set_names to set these attributes directly, and they default to returning a copy.
trans-unit.target: 索引“几乎是不可变的”，但是可以设置和更改其 name 属性。您可以使用 rename ， set_names 直接设置这些属性，它们默认为返回副本。

trans-unit.source: Indexes are automagically created on the indexables and any data columns you specify. This behavior can be turned off by passing index=False to append.
trans-unit.target: 索引是在可索引对象和您指定的任何数据列上自动创建的。可以通过将 index=False 传递给 append 来关闭此行为。

trans-unit.source: Indexes for column or row labels can be changed by assigning a list-like or Index.
trans-unit.target: 列或行标签的索引可以通过指定类似列表或索引来改变。

trans-unit.source: Indexes for row labels can be changed by assigning a list-like or Index.
trans-unit.target: 行标签的索引可以通过分配类似列表或索引来改变。

trans-unit.source: Indexing DataFrame rows with a single string with getitem (e.g. frame[dtstring]) is deprecated starting with pandas 1.2.0 (given the ambiguity whether it is indexing the rows or selecting a column) and will be removed in a future version. The equivalent with .loc (e.g. frame.loc[dtstring]) is still supported.
trans-unit.target: 从pandas 1.2.0开始不推荐使用带有带有getitem的单个字符串（例如 frame[dtstring] ）对 DataFrame 行进行索引（鉴于歧义是对行进行索引还是选择列），将在以后的版本中将其删除。仍然支持与 .loc 的等效项（例如 frame.loc[dtstring] ）。

trans-unit.source: Indicates remainder of line should not be parsed. If found at the beginning of a line, the line will be ignored altogether. This parameter must be a single character. Like empty lines (as long as skip_blank_lines=True), fully commented lines are ignored by the parameter
trans-unit.target: 指示不应分析行的其余部分。如果在一行的开头找到该行，则将完全忽略该行。此参数必须是单个字符。像空白行（只要 skip_blank_lines=True ）一样，参数完全忽略了注释行

trans-unit.source: Indicates remainder of line should not be parsed. If found at the beginning of a line, the line will be ignored altogether. This parameter must be a single character. Like empty lines (as long as skip_blank_lines=True), fully commented lines are ignored by the parameter header but not by skiprows. For example, if comment='#', parsing ‘#empty\na,b,c\n1,2,3’ with header=0 will result in ‘a,b,c’ being treated as the header.
trans-unit.target: 指示不应分析行的其余部分。如果在一行的开头找到该行，则将完全忽略该行。此参数必须是单个字符。像空行（只要 skip_blank_lines=True ）一样，参数 header 会忽略完全注释的行，而 skiprows 不会。例如，如果 comment='#' ，则解析 header=0 '#empty \ na，b，c \ n1,2,3'将导致'a，b，c'被视为标头。

trans-unit.source: Indicates remainder of line should not be parsed. If found at the beginning of a line, the line will be ignored altogether. This parameter must be a single character. Like empty lines (as long as skip_blank_lines=True), fully commented lines are ignored by the parameter header but not by skiprows. For example, if comment='#', parsing #empty\na,b,c\n1,2,3 with header=0 will result in ‘a,b,c’ being treated as the header.
trans-unit.target: 指示不应分析行的其余部分。如果在一行的开头找到该行，则将完全忽略该行。此参数必须是单个字符。像空行一样（只要 skip_blank_lines=True ），参数 header 会忽略完全注释的行，而 skiprows 不会。例如，如果 comment='#' ，解析 #empty\na,b,c\n1,2,3 与 header=0 将导致'A，B，C'被视为标题。

trans-unit.target: 指示 bins 是否包括最右边。如果 right == True （默认值），则 bins [1, 2, 3, 4] 表示（1,2]，（2,3]，（3,4]。当 bins 是IntervalIndex 时，将忽略此参数。

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that the take method on pandas objects are not intended to work on boolean indices and may return unexpected results.
trans-unit.target: 重要的是要注意，pandas对象上的 take 方法不适用于布尔索引，并且可能返回意外结果。

trans-unit.source: It is important to note that tuples and lists are not treated identically in pandas when it comes to indexing. Whereas a tuple is interpreted as one multi-level key, a list is used to specify several keys. Or in other words, tuples go horizontally (traversing levels), lists go vertically (scanning levels).
trans-unit.target: 需要注意的是,在pandas中,当涉及到索引时,元组和列表的处理方式并不相同。元组被解释为一个多级键,而列表则用来指定多个键。或者换句话说,元组是横向的(遍历层次),列表是纵向的(扫描层次)。

trans-unit.source: It should be clear that a delete operation on the major_axis will be fairly quick, as one chunk is removed, then the following data moved. On the other hand a delete operation on the minor_axis will be very expensive. In this case it would almost certainly be faster to rewrite the table using a where that selects all but the missing data.
trans-unit.target: 应该清楚的是，在 major_axis 上执行删除操作将相当快，因为​​删除了一个块，然后移动了以下数据。另一方面，对 minor_axis 的删除操作将非常昂贵。在这种情况下，它几乎肯定会更快使用重写表 where ，用于选择，但所有丢失数据。

trans-unit.source: It’s calling series… a lot! It’s creating a Series from each row, and get-ting from both the index and the series (three times for each row). Function calls are expensive in Python, so maybe we could minimize these by cythonizing the apply part.
trans-unit.target: 这叫系列……很多！它从每一行创建一个Series，并从索引和序列（每行三次）获取结果。在Python中，函数调用非常昂贵，因此也许我们可以通过对应用部分进行cythonize来将其最小化。

trans-unit.source: Iteratively appending rows to a DataFrame can be more computationally intensive than a single concatenate. A better solution is to append those rows to a list and then concatenate the list with the original DataFrame all at once.
trans-unit.target: 迭代地将行追加到DataFrame中可能比单一的连接更耗费计算量。一个更好的解决方案是将这些行追加到一个列表中,然后一次性将列表与原始DataFrame连接起来。

trans-unit.source: Its Variable Explorer allows users to view, manipulate and edit pandas Index, Series, and DataFrame objects like a “spreadsheet”, including copying and modifying values, sorting, displaying a “heatmap”, converting data types and more. Pandas objects can also be renamed, duplicated, new columns added, copyed/pasted to/from the clipboard (as TSV), and saved/loaded to/from a file. Spyder can also import data from a variety of plain text and binary files or the clipboard into a new pandas DataFrame via a sophisticated import wizard.
trans-unit.target: 其变量浏览器允许用户查看，操纵和编辑pandas Index ， Series 和 DataFrame 对象，就像“电子表格”一样，包括复制和修改值，排序，显示“热图”，转换数据类型等等。熊猫对象也可以重命名，复制，添加新列，从剪贴板复制/粘贴（作为TSV），以及从文件保存/加载。Spyder还可以通过完善的导入向导将各种纯文本和二进制文件或剪贴板中的数据导入到新的熊猫DataFrame中。

trans-unit.source: Jupyter Notebook is a web application for creating Jupyter notebooks. A Jupyter notebook is a JSON document containing an ordered list of input/output cells which can contain code, text, mathematics, plots and rich media. Jupyter notebooks can be converted to a number of open standard output formats (HTML, HTML presentation slides, LaTeX, PDF, ReStructuredText, Markdown, Python) through ‘Download As’ in the web interface and jupyter convert in a shell.
trans-unit.target: Jupyter Notebook是用于创建Jupyter Notebook的Web应用程序。Jupyter笔记本是JSON文档，其中包含输入/输出单元格的有序列表，其中可以包含代码，文本，数学，图解和富媒体。Jupyter笔记本可以通过Web界面中的“下载为”转换为多种开放标准输出格式（HTML，HTML演示幻灯片，LaTeX，PDF，ReStructuredText，Markdown，Python）， jupyter convert 在外壳中进行jupyter转换。

trans-unit.source: Keys to a store can be specified as a string. These can be in a hierarchical path-name like format (e.g. foo/bar/bah), which will generate a hierarchy of sub-stores (or Groups in PyTables parlance). Keys can be specified without the leading ‘/’ and are always absolute (e.g. ‘foo’ refers to ‘/foo’). Removal operations can remove everything in the sub-store and below, so be careful.
trans-unit.target: 商店的密钥可以指定为字符串。它们可以采用类似路径的分层路径名格式（例如 foo/bar/bah ），这将生成子存储的层次结构（或PyTables中的 Groups ）。可以指定键而不能以“ /”开头，并且它们始终是绝对的（例如，“ foo”指的是“ / foo”）。删除操作可能会删除子商店及以下子商店中的所有内容，因此请当心。

trans-unit.source: Label-based indexing with integer axis labels is a thorny topic. It has been discussed heavily on mailing lists and among various members of the scientific Python community. In pandas, our general viewpoint is that labels matter more than integer locations. Therefore, with an integer axis index only label-based indexing is possible with the standard tools like .loc. The following code will generate exceptions:

trans-unit.source: Lag plots are most commonly used to look for patterns in time series data.

trans-unit.source: Lag plots are used to check if a data set or time series is random. Random data should not exhibit any structure in the lag plot. Non-random structure implies that the underlying data are not random. The lag argument may be passed, and when lag=1 the plot is essentially data[:-1] vs. data[1:].
trans-unit.target: 滞后图用于检查数据集或时间序列是否随机。随机数据在滞后图中不应显示任何结构。非随机结构意味着基础数据不是随机的。该 lag 参数可被传递，并且当 lag=1 的曲线图基本上是 data[:-1] 与 data[1:] 。

trans-unit.target: 从DataFrame列制作盒须图,并可选择由其他列分组。箱形图是一种通过四分位数来图形化描述数值数据组的方法。箱子从数据的Q1到Q3的四分位值延伸,在中位数(Q2)处有一条线。晶须从方框的边缘延伸,以显示数据的范围。默认情况下,它们的延伸长度不超过

trans-unit.source: Make a box-and-whisker plot from DataFrame columns, optionally grouped by some other columns. A box plot is a method for graphically depicting groups of numerical data through their quartiles. The box extends from the Q1 to Q3 quartile values of the data, with a line at the median (Q2). The whiskers extend from the edges of box to show the range of the data. The position of the whiskers is set by default to 1.5 * IQR (IQR = Q3 - Q1) from the edges of the box. Outlier points are those past the end of the whiskers.
trans-unit.target: 从DataFrame列制作箱须图，可以选择按其他一些列进行分组。箱形图是一种通过四分位数以图形方式描绘数字数据组的方法。该框从数据的Q1四分位数扩展到Q3四分位数，并且在中间值（Q2）处有一条线。晶须从框的边缘延伸以显示数据范围。从框的边缘起，晶须的位置默认设置为 1.5 * IQR (IQR = Q3 - Q1) 。异常点是晶须结束后的那些。

trans-unit.source: Manually chunking is an OK option for workflows that don’t require too sophisticated of operations. Some operations, like groupby, are much harder to do chunkwise. trans-unit.target: 可以使用GroupBy操作来表达多种复杂的数据操作（尽管不能保证效率最高）。使用标签映射功能，您可以变得很有创意。

trans-unit.source: Many of these principles are here to address the shortcomings frequently experienced using other languages / scientific research environments. For data scientists, working with data is typically divided into multiple stages: munging and cleaning data, analyzing / modeling it, then organizing the results of the analysis into a form suitable for plotting or tabular display. pandas is the ideal tool for all of these tasks.
trans-unit.target: 其中许多原则是为了解决使用其他语言/科研环境经常遇到的缺点而来。对于数据科学家来说,处理数据通常分为多个阶段:混杂和清理数据,分析/建模,然后将分析结果组织成适合绘图或表格显示的形式。

trans-unit.source: Many people have suggested that NumPy should simply emulate the NA support present in the more domain-specific statistical programming language R. Part of the reason is the NumPy type hierarchy:
trans-unit.target: 许多人建议NumPy应该简单地模拟更领域特定的统计编程语言R中提供的 NA 支持。部分原因是NumPy类型层次结构：

trans-unit.source: Many workflows involve a large amount of data and processing it in a way that reduces the size to something that fits in memory. In this case, we’ll resample to daily frequency and take the mean. Once we’ve taken the mean, we know the results will fit in memory, so we can safely call compute without running out of memory. At that point it’s just a regular pandas object.
trans-unit.target: 许多工作流程涉及大量数据，并以将大小减小到适合内存的方式进行处理。在这种情况下，我们将重新采样到每日频率并取平均值。一旦取了平均值，我们就知道结果将适合内存，因此我们可以安全地调用 compute ,而不会耗尽内存。那时，它只是一个普通的熊猫对象。
